- The machine turned on only once when object 0 was placed on it, along with objects 6 and 7.
- The machine did not turn on when objects 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, or 7 were placed on it individually or in various combinations without object 0.
- When object 0 was placed on the machine again, the machine turned on, even when object 4 was removed.

This suggests that object 0 is a blicket, as it is the only object that consistently causes the machine to turn on. There is no evidence that object 7 is a blicket because the machine did not turn on when object 7 was placed on it without object 0.

Therefore, based on the information collected, object 7 is not a blicket.

> False
